message: ...is a Lisp. (I guess someone needs to start the conversation somehow. :P)
I haven't used much Clojure yet. I'm about to preorder "The Joy of Clojure" on my next paycheck.
the joy of clojure is a good choice. I've read it and it's easy to understand.
Thanks for the heads up. I tried asking fogus on #clojure if the book covers swank/slime. He was away and I never got a response back. Did you read anything about a workflow with lein and swank?
I noticed he uses a project.clj on his source repository for the book.

Neither Leiningen nor Swank are covered in the book (although both are mentioned - one time each). I don't think it's the place of a book on the "why" of Clojure to cover build tools or IDEs - those are covered in depth elsewhere (and they're also a very subjective choice). I use lein all the time but never use swank (because I use CounterClockWise in Eclipse).
